etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") + 乍(乍) (zhà, "for the first time") = sun with temporal aspect -> yesterday
etymology.interpretation: The character 昨(昨) (zuó, "yesterday") combines 日(日) (rì, "sun") indicating the cyclical nature of time with 乍(乍) (zhà, "for the first time"), which adds a phonetic and partial semantic component, suggesting a time related to prior events, thus forming the meaning 'yesterday'.

examples.chinese: 昨天晚上(昨天晚上)，我看了一场电影(我看了一場電影)。
examples.pinyin: zuótiān wǎnshàng, wǒ kàn le yī chǎng diànyǐng
examples.english: Last night, I watched a movie.

examples.chinese: 昨天下起了雨(昨天下起了雨)。
昨夜星空格外明亮(昨夜星空格外明亮)。
examples.english: The stars were especially bright last night.
